timeline.message:
Don't fetch unshallow during release

No Sonar, no need for full history.

Use new checkout option to fetch unshallow

Should have the same effect: https://github.com/actions/checkout#fetch-all-history-for-all-tags-and-branches

Name workflows consistently

And remove default comments.

timeline.bodyText: i want to start a discussion here, i think this build is redundant as it is part of the name of the action, and i think it has a nice reading in the gui without it. I just want to check in what you think about - but that was my initial thought when i removed it.
timeline.author: aepfli

replies.bodyText: Yeah, totally agree! Saw it in the UI after the PR. So yes, I will remove that redundancy.
replies.author: beatngu13

replies.bodyText: i also thought about to rename it like, build with Java 8 on ubuntu - because i think naming wise it is nicer to have the first information aligned rather than the last one
replies.author: aepfli

replies.bodyText: maybe we should also name the gradle wrapper validation gha as validate and the job Gradle Wrapper - so we could theoretically validate more in there, and would also have the same naming scheme
replies.author: aepfli

replies.bodyText:
Removed the redundancy and now included the OS everywhere, I think this plays well with the workflow name.
Not sure about your last comment. Usually, I'm in favor of validating (in the sense of mvn validate) as soon as possible in the main build pipeline, so that the build aborts early in case of a failure.
However, I'm open in this regard. What do you think?
replies.author: beatngu13

replies.bodyText: what i meant is that the gradle validation could also be a just a file called validation.yml instead of gradle-wrapper-validation.yml - the name of the GHA could be Validate and the name of the (currently only) job could be gradle wrapper compared to now where the GHA is named Gradle Wrapper Validation and the job is named validate. to be consistent with the other namings, and to allow us to add other validations into this GHA :)
replies.author: aepfli
